Articles.Content:
This is my first challenge. I hope you enjoy!

Kerbol is going supernova. Eve and Moho have already been engulfed by the flames! Kerbal scientists have concluded that Kerbin is next, but their instruments over at the tracking station have predicted that Duna will be just out of its reach! It's up to you to get as many Kerbals to Duna, or beyond before Kerbin is destroyed. You have 10 years game time to get as many Kerbals to Duna as possible. Or on hard mode, 5 or less! After this amount of time has passed you can no longer launch any missions from KSC.

Rules;

1. You can use part mods, but no godmods for infinite fuel, please!

2. You cannot use cheats!

This is how the scoring system will work:

For every Kerbal you get to Duna you will gain 100 points. If you get them to any of the Joolian moons or anywhere beyond that you get an extra 50 points for each Kerbal brought there.

For each Kerbal you lose you will be deducted 5 points. You can't restart the flight if you crash and kerbals are destroyed! You can quicksave, though.

You must start on a new save, and all ships used must also be made by you! You can use the stock lander and such to build your ship, but you cannot use downloaded ships!

You can use refueling vessels.

You can gain an extra 20 points for each ship landed within 400 meters from each other.

Post pictures of your successful landings in the tracking station and tell how many kerbals were on each ship!

This is my first challenge, so if you see anything you would like me to add, or anything like that, let me know!

1) A supernova would induce temporary biosphere collapse ten light years away - 10 or so light-minutes are not getting through it.

2) All that is required to win this challenge is to never use warp, and continuously lob ships up into the sky for ten years.
Which makes the game into a horribly over-complicated grind-fest like World of Warcraft.
Yeah, I dunno about that second one, bro xDD
